title: Simple local order system with Zelle/Venmo payment
description:
## Goal
Enable customers to place orders through the shop and pay via Zelle/Venmo for in-person delivery - zero payment processing overhead.

## Context
- Customers are local (school/workplace - see them daily)
- Delivery is in-person, no shipping needed
- Payment via Zelle or Venmo (peer-to-peer, no fees)
- Want to avoid payment processor fees and complexity

## Proposed Approach

### Phase 1: Order Submission (No Payment Integration)
- [ ] Cart checkout creates order with customer name/contact
- [ ] Order saved to localStorage with status "pending_payment"
- [ ] Show Zelle/Venmo info after order submission
- [ ] Display order summary with total and payment instructions
- [ ] Generate simple order ID for reference

### Phase 2: Order Management (Parent/Admin View)
- [ ] Simple admin page to view pending orders
- [ ] Mark orders as "paid" when Zelle/Venmo received
- [ ] Mark orders as "delivered" when handed off
- [ ] Order history for both customer and admin

### Phase 3: Optional Enhancements
- [ ] QR code for Zelle/Venmo payment
- [ ] Order confirmation via email (if email collected)
- [ ] Print-friendly order slip

## Payment Flow
1. Customer adds items to cart
2. Customer enters name + contact (classroom/period or phone)
3. Order submitted → shows Zelle/Venmo payment info
4. Customer sends payment with order ID in memo
5. Admin marks paid when payment received
6. Admin marks delivered when item handed over

## Technical Notes
- Keep it simple: localStorage first, no backend needed initially
- Could evolve to use a simple JSON file or Google Sheet for persistence
- Zelle/Venmo don't have APIs - just display payment info with instructions

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] Customer can complete checkout without credit card
- [ ] Order ID generated for tracking
- [ ] Payment instructions clearly displayed
- [ ] Admin can track order status
- [ ] Works offline (localStorage)

title: Add Tinkercad integration for in-browser 3D design
description:
## Overview
Integrate Autodesk Tinkercad to allow kids to design 3D models directly from LayerBEE, then order prints of their creations.

## Why Tinkercad
- Free, browser-based 3D design tool
- Kid-friendly interface (ages 8+)
- No software installation required
- Exports STL files for 3D printing
- Already widely used in schools

## Integration Options

### Option A: Link Out
- Add "Design in Tinkercad" button
- Link to tinkercad.com with tutorial
- Kids export STL and upload to shop

### Option B: Embed Gallery
- Embed Tinkercad gallery of starter designs
- "Remix this design" workflow
- More guided experience

### Option C: Deep Integration
- Tinkercad API for design embedding
- Direct STL export to shop cart
- Requires Autodesk developer account

## Research Needed
- Tinkercad embed/API capabilities
- Autodesk developer program requirements
- COPPA compliance for kid accounts
- Alternative: OpenSCAD web editor?

## User Flow
1. Kid clicks "Design Your Own" on shop page
2. Opens Tinkercad (new tab or embed)
3. Creates/modifies design
4. Exports STL
5. Uploads to LayerBEE shop for quote
6. Submits for parent review

title: Add feedback-to-BEADS system for user input collection
description:
## Overview
Implement a feedback collection system similar to md-cte-crosswalk that converts user feedback into BEADS issues for AI orchestration.

## Reference Implementation
See md-cte-crosswalk feedback system:
- Frontend modal with type selector (general/bug/suggestion/question)
- Honeypot + timestamp spam prevention
- PII auto-redaction (email, phone, SSN, credit card)
- BEADS markdown file generation with triage checklist

## Options for LayerBEE (Static Site)

### Option A: localStorage Collector
- Add feedback button/modal to site
- Save feedback to localStorage
- Claude Code skill processes localStorage → BEADS issues

### Option B: Simple Backend
- Minimal FastAPI/Express endpoint just for feedback
- Direct BEADS file generation like CTE Crosswalk

### Option C: Use /wf-wants-this-done
- No code changes needed
- Manually paste feedback into Claude Code
- Skill creates issue + starts execution

## Key Files (CTE Crosswalk Reference)
- frontend/src/routes/+layout.svelte - Modal UI
- api/main.py lines 1261-1520 - Backend + BEADS generation

title: Add custom file upload for print quotes
description:
## Goal
Allow customers to upload their own STL/3D model files to get printing quotes, expanding the shop beyond pre-made products.

## Current State
The LayerBEE Print Shop currently only offers pre-defined products (phone stands, keychains, etc.) with fixed prices. Customers cannot submit their own designs for printing.

## Tasks
- [ ] Add file upload UI to shop page (drag-and-drop + file picker)
- [ ] Support common 3D file formats (STL, OBJ, 3MF)
- [ ] Validate file size limits (reasonable for school context)
- [ ] Show file preview/thumbnail if possible
- [ ] Calculate quote based on estimated print time/material
- [ ] Add uploaded file to cart with quote price
- [ ] Store file reference in order for parent review

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] Users can upload STL files up to reasonable size limit
- [ ] Invalid files show clear error messages
- [ ] Quote calculation considers material and estimated time
- [ ] Uploaded items appear in cart like regular products
- [ ] Parent review shows file info for custom prints
- [ ] Works on both desktop and mobile

## Technical Considerations
- File storage: localStorage blob URLs or base64 for MVP
- Quote algorithm: Could use simple file-size heuristic initially
- Security: Validate file type client-side, no server execution

title: Evaluate Bambu Studio / 3D File Integration Options
description:
## Goal
Decide on the best approach for integrating 3D model handling into LayerBEE - specifically support for Bambu Studio and STL/OBJ files.

## Options to Consider

### 1. 3D Model Viewer (Browser-based)
- Upload & view STL/OBJ files directly in browser
- Use Three.js for rendering
- Features: rotate, zoom, pan, measure
- **Pros**: Educational preview before printing, no external software needed
- **Cons**: Viewer only, no slicing capability

### 2. Bambu Studio Educational Guide
- Module teaching students how to use Bambu Studio
- Screenshots, video tutorials, step-by-step guides
- **Pros**: Complements existing curriculum, low development effort
- **Cons**: Requires students to download separate software

### 3. Bambu Lab Integration
- Connect to Bambu Studio API or Bambu Lab cloud
- Remote print monitoring, file transfer
- **Pros**: Seamless workflow for Bambu printer owners
- **Cons**: Vendor lock-in, requires API access

### 4. Full Web-Based Slicer
- Browser-based slicing (generates G-code)
- Would need to port/adapt OrcaSlicer or similar
- **Pros**: Complete solution, no external software
- **Cons**: Very complex, significant development effort

## Decision Criteria
- Target audience (students with/without Bambu printers)
- Development complexity vs educational value
- Maintenance burden
- Works offline / in-browser philosophy

## Next Steps
- [ ] Research Three.js STL/OBJ viewer implementations
- [ ] Check Bambu Lab API availability
- [ ] Survey which printers students typically have access to
- [ ] Make decision and create implementation plan
